name: satellite
content:
satellite noun [C]
(IN SPACE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 a device sent up into space to travel around the earth, used for collecting information or communicating by radio, television, etc.: The World Cup was transmitted around the world by satellite. a spy/weather satellite satellite television/TV
Erik Simonsen/Photographer's Choice/GettyImages
a natural object moving around a larger object in space: The moon is Earth's satellite.
More examplesFewer examplesThe satellite will fragment and burn up as it falls through the earth's atmosphere.We hope to bring you a live report from Ouagadougou via our satellite hook-up.The concert was beamed by satellite all over the world.The satellite will observe objects that are particularly interesting astronomically.The arrival of satellite television changed the face of broadcasting.
